reviews.text: This hotel is without a doubt in the best possible location of Monterey, however that's where the advantages end.
reviews.title: Not what you expect from a full service Marriott

reviews.text: The room is average in terms of size for this area, however the TV is painfully small and most of the channels had a great deal of fuzziness or pixilation to the point of some cable channels simply not working for minutes on end.
reviews.title: Downtown Monterey

reviews.text: There is no mini-fridge so I figured I would walk down to ice/vending area and get a bottle of water, and fill my ice bucket. After a long, long walk to the area I discovered the vending machines were out of water.
reviews.title: Annoying internet policy

reviews.text: I wanted to order room service, so I opened up the standard issue Marriott binder and opened it up to services, scrolled to "room service" and it said "see separate room service tab"... Well, there was no room service tab so my room was completely without a menu to order room service.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel, good location

reviews.text: I am a platinum Marriott member, and frequent Monterey. It is my suggestion that you consider The Portolo Hotel next door, I have stayed there and find it to be vastly superior to the Marriott, and even though I cannot collect any rewards points there, it will be where I stay from now on.
reviews.title: Great hotel right in the heart of Monterey. Great customer service!
Good location, nice amenities, a bit tired
reviews.text: The bell staff and front desk were very friendly and accomodating. Overnight parking was reasonable. While the hotel says non-smoking, it was clear that our room had been frequented by smokers. The room was very large, but the decor was average, a bit tired by Marriott standards. Perhaps because I was using points, they gave us an undesirable room. But we enjoyed our stay overall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, clean hotel and friendly staff. We were upgraded to a suite with a living room, kitchenette, dining table & a huge balcony. The room service breakfast was delicious.
reviews.title: Great hotel!
Trailer house windows
reviews.text: The Motel is remodeled it still has new carpet smell, they have wireless wi-fi in the rooms. Our room which was not 300.00 had a refrigerator. If you're an elite member you get free wi-fi and breakfast. The staff was great from the valet, desk, even the maids were friendly...my problem was the windows. We were on the 8th floor with a bay view, but couldn't enjoy it because of all the noise from the pool area below. The windows are not insulated and infact had big gaps at the top. Makes what should have been a great experience in a very nice hotel less than exceptable. The pool does close at 10pm so that is a plus. After that we enjoyed a great evening

This hotel is good and as expected but has nothing special to distinguish it from many others. The architecture is very plain as if no effort was made at all, the rooms are fine, the breakfast buffet is good but not spectacular. It is a short walk from the seafront. There is a pool and a gym.
reviews.title: Marriott Monterey

reviews.text: The bar facilities are pathetic, bar filty and filled with screaming children playing video games, service non existent. And they still ad the very famous American obligatory tip. Immaterial of the standard of service. There are no lounge facilities, and no proper restaurant, visiting from South Africa very disappointed in the standards,
reviews.title: Poor service and quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical Marriott property with fluffy comfy beds. Great location. We were celebrating our anniversary, so we got a complimentary upgrade to a roof top corner suite where we found a chilled bottle of champagne with chocolate dipped strawberries awaiting us. Front desk and valet were so friendly and nice. The only thing is that they do not have in room safe! Very inconvenient.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

reviews.text: Otherwise would stay again.
reviews.title: Nice location, get out of your room....

reviews.text: This Marriott is in a great location in the center of Monterey within easy walking distance of the conference center, the bay and the downtown bars and restaurants. It is a very short distance to Cannery Row and the Acquarium.
reviews.title: Horrible valet service, nice hotel

reviews.text: The Monterey Marriott is a nice hotel overall, and we've stayed there consistently for years.
reviews.title: Great location, but paid parking and somewhat outdated rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, two weeks ago, I had a really, really bad experience with the valet. When I called the valet for my car, he said 5 minutes. It took 40 MINUTES for the car to arrive.
reviews.title: Pleasant Staff. Unimpressed By Rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took Amtrak from San Diego, and paid for their bus ride from Salinas to this Marriott. I loved the room - the colors were light and decor pleasant. The bathroom was nice as well. The service was excellent. We enjoyed their breakfast buffet - the continental included hard-boiled eggs and cheese, plus everything else usually included (especially good fruit). Although several TA reviews said ask for a room not facing the street, we did anyway to get a nice view. We enjoyed the view of the bay, but the first night, it was noisy in the middle of the night- I think from people leaving their sports bar and spending a lot of time outside talking very loudly. I slept through it the second night, though. I really loved the location. I felt like I was in the middle of a small town and enjoyed walking the area. I liked taking the free "trolley bus" across the way to the aquarium, etc. Fodor's recommended a restaurant right next to the hotel, Montrio Bistro. Their food is excellent. We also ate at Rosine's Restaurant, 434 Alvarado St. Good home cooking, reasonable prices. Be warned, though: They have several irresistable 6-layer cakes on display. I had the lemon and in took me 3 days to finish it! I look forward to staying here again and will probably get a front facing room again for the view.
reviews.title: Loved this location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is plenty to do, several excellent restaurants and places to shop within walking distance of the Monterey Marriott. The service received from all staff members was excellent. This was the first time we stayed at this Marriott and the first time we have stayed in Downtown Monterey. We were in Monterey to celebrate our 46th Anniversary. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Excellent Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: This was my fifth trip to Monterey for a conference. It has a great location and was very convenient to the conference center next door. Hotel staff are very friendly. Public areas were kept immaculately. Convenience to bars and restuarants made for great evenings after the conference.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location for visiting cannery row, the aquarium and the wharf. Our room was on the 9th floor with a nice view of the pool and peek at the bay. The bathroom did not look like it had been cleaned when we checked in and the wallpaper was peeling off. At 6:00 in the morning we heard loud engine noises that seemed to be coming from the pool area. We also ran out of toilet paper in the middle of the night and there was not any extra in the room and room service had to be called and told to bring some up and leave it outside the door as not to wake others sleeping in the room. When we checked in we were told that we had a choice of newspapers and our choice would be delivered to our room in the morning, this never happened. Our breakfast in the morning was excellent.
reviews.title: Noisy morning, room not properly stocked with essentials

reviews.text: This was my second stay ath this hotel. It was undergoing some rennovation the last time I stayed and has been greatly improved since my last stay so I thought it was worth re-reviewing. The location couldn't be nicer - only a block or two from Fisherman's wharf. On the next street over there's a Farmers Market / Craft Fair on Tuesdays. Every staff member I encountered was very professional and courteous. I would highly recommend this hotel whether on business or vacation.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location

reviews.text: We've requested for a higher floor to have a bayview, but got the roofs view instead, on a Sunday. The rooms setup is like a maze. The shower curtain had a fresh blood; clearly that it wasn't cleaned by the housekeeper. Now the positive points: The bellmen made sure that they open the doors for their guests; impressive. The only hotel that we had this experience was at the Trump Hotel in Hawaii. The beds were comfortable and we had extra very nice pillows. The breakfast was the highlight of my stay and the service of our waitress too. I recommend this hotel just because of their great service and their delicious breakfast.
reviews.title: "Great Service and Exceptionally Good Breakfast"

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here with our 2 teenage girls while visiting the area last week. This hotel is very well located, with a convenient walk to the Wharf, Cannery Row and even the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Rooms are nice and spacious, bedding was great, and the hotel was very well kept. The service staff was wonderful, friendly and very helpful. I don't personally care for the trend towards vanities that are open to the rest of the room, because it makes it very difficult to rise early and leave without disturbing the others, but the prevalence must suggest that others don't mind it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay near Cannery Row

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even so, when all was said and done, we all agreed that we wouldn't have stayed anywhere else and we highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: The Monterey Marriott was beautiful. We had reserved a standard king room but the staff upgraded us to an "elite" king room with a Monterey Bay view. The room was spacious and comfortable. The room was on the 9th floor of the hotel overlooking the Monterey Bay.
reviews.title: Beautiful Room

reviews.text: We purchased the "Stay for Breakfast" package and were not disappointed! The breakfast was a full buffet breakfast with made-to-order omelets, bread, bacon, sausage, fruits of all types, yogurts, etc. Too many choices to select. The breakfast was definitely worth the extra $20 per night!
reviews.title: Best breakfast buffet and a great location in Monterey!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel because it was a Marriott and my wife is a Platinum rewards member…
reviews.title: Monterey Marriott...A Nice hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was not disappointed with the surrounding area it was very nice and I felt safe walking around at night. There are several restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: A Best for Marriott

reviews.text: As for the hotel itself, the staff was very helpful and professional and they made my wife and I feel welcome as their guests. Check in was expedited quickly and courteously not much else to say about that. I had to pay for valet parking and wifi was not included, Boo…
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - exceeds expectations!
Exemplary Large Hotel
reviews.text: The room was a regular room with king bed. The room was clean. The bed was as I remembered Marriott beds to be and was quite comfortable for my taste.

reviews.title: Good choice for convention
reviews.text: We did not eat at the hotel. One of the hotel staff suggested Old Fisherman’s Grotto it was within a five minute walk and was very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nighs as part of our California road trip for our honeymoon. We had paid for a sea view room but we were upgraded to an elite room, on getting to our room we had a card, chocolate dipped strawberries and a bottle of bubbly. This was such a nice touch and got our stay of on the perfect note. We used the valet parking, when you wanted your car we just phoned down from our room and by the time we got down our car was there waiting. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Would happily recommend a stay here, make sure you go for a bay view room, we were on the 9th floor and the view was amazing,
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in February. Overall it was very nice. Exceptionally clean and comfortble. The staff was very cordial and helpful. The location was great as we were able to walk to many of the nearby attractions
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: What a great staff! Everyone makes eye contact and greets each guest. The valet team is excellent and they move fast! The doors are always opened and you are greeted with Welcome or Welcome back - every time! Great location for walking and enjoying the area around the hotel. Nice breakfast and the rooms are clean and well appointed. I would stay again and hope to do so!
reviews.title: Very nice stay in Monterey.

reviews.text: Located downtown near the water and great restaurants. The rooms are well appointed. The hotel was recently renovated so the rooms and linens are new and modern. The sports bar & restaurant is fun and the food is good. There is also a modern art gallery on the premises. Valet parking is pricey but there is a garage two blocks away where you can park for $5 a day.
reviews.title: Mix pleasure with business

reviews.text: We stayed as a family for one night only. Could go for an early check in which was really comfortable. You can get valet parking, but there is a parking garage nearby.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I enjoyed this hotel very much! It is immaculate, comfortable, great breakfast. The Hotel Personnel are very nice. The only thing (for me) and this hotel doesn't reflect the 'charm' of Monterey. It is basically a block building and nothing really speaks out at you. Its a beautiful and top notch place. For me, it just doesn't have character. Great Location, comfortable beds, nice views. I have nothing to say negative about the hotel, its personnel, or accomodation. Nice Pool and Hot Tub.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: Stayed here for my husband to attend a conference. Great location, easy walk over to Dennis the Menace Park, across the street from Starbucks and across the street from the conference center. Kids LOVED the pool and hot tub. Fitness room was really nice and clean. Room and bathroom were very clean, large, quiet, and beds were very comfortable. They were thoughtful to position us far from the elevator with our little ones. Staff was really friendly. Not far from the Monterey Aquarium. Great place to stay!
reviews.title: Weekend family stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love staying here. It's located in downtown Monterey, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and all the good restaurants downtown.
reviews.title: Good location, great views.

reviews.text: We had a great room overlooking the harbor and terrific weather made it doubly good.
reviews.title: Great hotel downtown.

reviews.text: We can definitely recommend this one.
reviews.title: Luxury at its finest
